page.title: 02ROWSLEY COUNTRYSIE
page.content: ROWSLEY COUNTRYSIDE OUR DOMESDAY SQUARE IS MOSTLY FIELDS AND ROUGH GRAZING . ONE OF THE PLACES THAT I LIKED BEST WASTHE BIT WHERE WE HAD OUR DINNER. IT WAS CALLED CHATSWORTH PARK THERE WAS AN OLD KNOCKED DOWN BUILDING THAT HAD GOT A MILL WHEEL BESIDE IT. CHATSWORTH IS A PLACE WHERE ANIMALS GRAZE AND THERE WAS ALOT OF DEAD ANIMALS ON THE ROAD. FIRST WE WENT THROUGH A WOOD WHERE THERE WAS A ROAD GOING THROUGH IT. ABOUT THREE QUARTERS OF THE WAY ROUND THERE WAS A MOOR THAT WAS REALLY FLAT ALL THE WAY THEN WE CAME TO A WOOD IT WAS ALL DARK UNDER THE PINE TREES AND THERE WERE PINE NEEDLES ON THE FLOOR AND IT WAS REALLY SOFT TO TREAD ON.AT THE TOP OF CHATSWORTH THERE WAS A WOOD WITH A HOUSE IN THE MIDDLE OF IT. WE GOT LOST AND A MAN CAME
